stories.text:
I have a question for HN that I ask myself ever since I started a career in software engineering for robotics:

How do you keep writing code and solve interesting problems while still climbing up the career ladder?

Is this even possible?

How do you respond to a leadership promotion that you know will involve 95% of your time writing powerpoints, making excel calculations, planning a budget, negotiating with different parties inside your company and the client, planning resources, etc.?

How do you navigate and mold such a career?

You don't want to be (seen as) that sad cliché programmer who only wants to be in front of his terminal all day and has no ambitions whatsoever.

I know there are more technical leadership roles that leave some room for technical work but I find it very hard to do both as the project managing often requires bursts of work here and there and disturb deeper problem solving sessions.

I really wonder how people who would like to keep coding and solve interesting problems still can have an ongoing career as software engineers without having to move into management roles and how to navigate this.
stories.title: Ask HN: How to keep coding while moving up the ladder?
